Class ProxyList<T>

ProxyList represents a generic list that is loaded from the database. It implements a pattern called lazy loading (also called just-in-time loading).
Lazy loading is a way to control how and when a list is loaded with the goal to load it only when it's absolutely necessary. This way the class prevent the application from executing unneccessary database hits. It's a way to better manage limited resources.

GoF Design Patterns: Proxy. Enterprise Design Patterns: Lazyload.

Namespace: Uvendia.Domain.Proxies
Assembly: Uvendia.Domain.dll
Syntax
public abstract class ProxyList<T> : IList<T>, ICollection<T>, IEnumerable<T>, IEnumerable
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Generic type stored in the list.
Remarks

This class is a Proxy because it 'stands in' for a limited resource. This class is a Lazy-loader because it does not load when constructed.
